title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Preparation

Preheat the oven to 170 °C (convection).
Puree dates with cream, vanilla bean seeds, and cocoa powder until smooth.
Then add egg yolks and butter, and blend until the mixture is homogeneous and smooth.
Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Mix the flour and baking soda into the cocoa mixture.
Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.
Pour the cake batter into any buttered baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven on the middle rack for approximately 40 minutes.

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Notes
The recipe yields 16 pieces and is also suitable for muffin molds. You can enhance the cake with orange zest, ground nuts, nut butter, chili, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, or cherries. I use soft dates, which are softer than regular dates. If you only have firm dates, soak them in warm water for about 4 hours. I would use a cake pan with a diameter of 18 cm. Source: https://www.chefkoch.de/rezepte/3186881474309297/Feiner-Schokokuchen-ohne-Zuckerzusatz.html

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Butter – use unsalted butter to saute onions
Yellow onion – it seems like a ton of onion but it disappears into the soup adding a balanced sweetness
Garlic – you’ll need 1 Tbsp minced from about 3 cloves
Crushed tomatoes – with their juice, preferably
San Marzano tomatoes Chicken stock – for the best flavor use homemade chicken broth
1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more to serve. Basil leaves are easily bruised so chop by stacking a bunch of leaves then roll them into a log and cut into thin strips.
Sugar – It’s just 1 Tbsp, but necessary to combat the tomato acidity.
Black pepper – start with 1/2 tsp and add more to taste
Whipping cream – adds a creaminess to the soup and offsets acidity.
Parmesan cheese – adds saltiness to the soup and balances acidity. Adding parmesan adds enough salt and I usually don’t add more.

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Butter – use unsalted butter to saute onions
Yellow onion – it seems like a ton of onion but it disappears into the soup adding a balanced sweetness
Garlic – you’ll need 1 Tbsp minced from about 3 cloves
Crushed tomatoes – with their juice, preferably
San Marzano tomatoes Chicken stock – for the best flavor use homemade chicken broth
1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more to serve. Basil leaves are easily bruised so chop by stacking a bunch of leaves then roll them into a log and cut into thin strips.
Sugar – It’s just 1 Tbsp, but necessary to combat the tomato acidity.
Black pepper – start with 1/2 tsp and add more to taste
Whipping cream – adds a creaminess to the soup and offsets acidity.
Parmesan cheese – adds saltiness to the soup and balances acidity. Adding parmesan adds enough salt and I usually don’t add more.

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Preparation

Saute Aromatics – heat a non-reactive pot over medium heat. Melt in 4 Tbsp butter then sautee onions until softened and golden (10-12 min). Add minced garlic and saute another minute.
Make the tomato soup base – stir in two 28 oz cans of crushed tomatoes with their juice, your chicken stock, chopped basil, sugar and black pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat, partially cover and simmer 10 minutes.
Blend if desired – use an immersion blender in the pot or blend in batches using a blender (be careful not to overfill the blender with hot liquid) and return soup to the pot.
Add cream and parmesan – stir in the heavy cream and shredded parmesan. Return to a simmer and season to taste if needed.
Serve – ladle into warm bowls and garnish with more parmesan and basil.

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1 Cup Granulated Sugar
1/2 Cup Cocoa Powder
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Cup Water
1/2 Cup Vegetable Oil or melted Coconut Oil
1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
1/4 Chopped Nuts (optional)

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1 Cup Granulated Sugar
1/2 Cup Cocoa Powder
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Cup Water
1/2 Cup Vegetable Oil or melted Coconut Oil
1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
1/4 Chopped Nuts (optional)

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
Procedure

Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking pan or line it with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
Add the water, vegetable oil (or melted coconut oil), and vanilla extract to the dry mixture. Stir until the batter is smooth and well combined.
If using, fold in the vegan chocolate chips and chopped nuts.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it out evenly. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.
Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.
Enjoy your vegan brownies plain or with a scoop of vegan ice cream on top!

Tips:
For an extra fudgy texture, reduce the baking time slightly. Feel free to customize your brownies with your favorite mix-ins like dried fruits or seeds.
Enjoy your homemade vegan brownies!

title: Pancakes
text: Not vegan, contains eggs and milk!

title: Pancakes
text:
Ingredients

250 g flour
2 tablespoons baking powder
500 g milk
2 or 3 eggs
A bit of butter

title: Pancakes
text:
Preparation

Mix the flour and the baking powder
Slowly add the milk and mix
Add the eggs and mix
Add a bit of butter to a large pan and heat
Make the pancakes

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
Preparation

Brownies

Melt dark chocolate with butter in a double boiler. Let it cool briefly.
Mix vanilla sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together.
Add the chocolate-butter mixture and mix.
Mix flour with baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder, and stir into the remaining batter.
Grease a brownie pan (28.5 x 23 cm).
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (convection: 160 degrees).
Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes.
Allow the brownies to cool completely.



Cherry Compote

Drain the Morello cherries over a sieve, collecting 400ml of juice.
Mix about 2 tbsp of the juice with cornstarch and powdered sugar until smooth.
Heat the remaining juice in a pot. Add the starch-juice mixture and bring to a boil until it starts to thicken.
Add the drained cherries and stir well.
Let it cool slightly.



Creamy Quark Cream

Whip the cream until stiff and mix with low-fat quark and powdered sugar.
Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the cherry mixture onto the brownie pieces in the glass.



Assembly

Take 1 tablespoon of brownies and break it into small pieces.
Place brownie pieces in dessert glasses (approx. 125ml filling capacity).
Pipe a layer of cream onto the cherry mixture in each glass.
Repeat this process for another layer in each dessert glass.
Refrigerate dessert glasses until ready to serve.

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
Source
https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/schwarzwaelder-kirsch-dessert-einfach-selber-machen

title: Lentil Bolognese
text:
1 clove of garlic
1 onion
1 carrot
1 stalk of celery
1 tbsp olive oil
2 tablespoons tomato paste
150 g red lentils
400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)
250 ml vegetable stock
1 tbsp Italian herbs
salt
pepper

title: Lentil Bolognese
text:
1 clove of garlic
1 onion
1 carrot
1 stalk of celery
1 tbsp olive oil
2 tablespoons tomato paste
150 g red lentils
400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)
250 ml vegetable stock
1 tbsp Italian herbs
salt
pepper

title: Lentil Bolognese
text:
Procedure

Wash the lentils thoroughly, then set aside.
Finely chop the garlic and onion, dice the carrot and celery.
Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions.
Add the carrots and celery and fry for 5 minutes over a medium heat.
Stir in the tomato purée, garlic and herbs.
Add the tomato purée, vegetable stock and lentils, bring to the boil, cover and simmer over a medium heat for 15 minutes. Add water if necessary.

Source: https://www.gaumenfreundin.de/rote-linsenbolognese-einfach-und-vegan/

title: Banana Brownies
text:
3 bananas
300 g Dark chocolate coating
250 g butter
3 eggs (size M)
250 g sugar
50 ml of neutral oil (e.g. sunflower oil)
2 TSP vanilla extract
200 g wheat flour (type 405)
30 g Baking cocoa
1 TSP baking powder
some butter and wheat flour for the cake pan

title: Banana Brownies
text:
3 bananas
300 g Dark chocolate coating
250 g butter
3 eggs (size M)
250 g sugar
50 ml of neutral oil (e.g. sunflower oil)
2 TSP vanilla extract
200 g wheat flour (type 405)
30 g Baking cocoa
1 TSP baking powder
some butter and wheat flour for the cake pan

title: Banana Brownies
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees top/bottom heat (fan oven: 160 degrees). Grease a baking tin (20 cm x 23 cm) with a little butter and dust with flour. For the batter, peel the bananas and mash with a fork to a fine paste.
Finely chop the dark chocolate coating and melt it together with the butter in a metal bowl over a hot water bath. Beat the eggs and sugar until frothy, then mix in the melted chocolate mixture and the oil. Stir in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract.
Mix the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder in a bowl and sieve into the batter. Mix in briefly, then pour into the prepared tin and smooth out.
Bake the brownies in a preheated oven for approx. 30-35 minutes. Leave to cool for at least 2 hours after baking.

title: Banana Brownies
text:
Source
https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/bananen-brownies-so-saftig-schokoladig

title: Iranian Stew Fesenjan
text:
Walnuts: To create the luscious sauce, I finely grind the walnuts.
Onion: Imbues the dish with a fresh aromatic flavor.
Chicken Thighs: When it comes to slow-cooking thighs are a top choice. Alternatively, you can use chicken drumsticks or quarters. Remove the skin but leave the bone in for further flavor.
Extra Virgin Olive Oil: The walnuts release a lot of oil so you only need a little extra virgin olive oil to fry the onions.
Turmeric, Cinnamon and Saffron: These spices flavor the stew with subtle earthy (turmeric), woody (cinnamon) and floral (saffron) tones. The overall feeling from this stew is warm. If you’re curious about saffron, one of the world’s most interesting spices, learn all about it in our What Is Saffron? Essential Guide.
Water: The cooking liquid and basis of the rich pomegranate molasses and walnut sauce.
Pomegranate Molasses: This gives the stew the sour flavor and helps to balance the richness of the walnuts in the sauce. It also gives the fesenjan its beautiful dark brown color. You can purchase it or make it yourself by using this homemade pomegranate molasses recipe.
Sugar balances and complements the tartness of the pomegranate molasses.
Salt and freshly ground black pepper elevates the other flavors and adds a subtle heat.
Pomegranate Seeds: Sprinkle these little jewel-toned bursts of flavor over the top of the stew as a garnish just before serving.

title: Iranian Stew Fesenjan
text:

Turmeric, Cinnamon and Saffron: These spices flavor the stew with subtle earthy (turmeric), woody (cinnamon) and floral (saffron) tones. The overall feeling from this stew is warm. If you’re curious about saffron, one of the world’s most interesting spices, learn all about it in our What Is Saffron? Essential Guide.
Water: The cooking liquid and basis of the rich pomegranate molasses and walnut sauce.
Pomegranate Molasses: This gives the stew the sour flavor and helps to balance the richness of the walnuts in the sauce. It also gives the fesenjan its beautiful dark brown color. You can purchase it or make it yourself by using this homemade pomegranate molasses recipe.
Sugar balances and complements the tartness of the pomegranate molasses.

Pomegranate Seeds: Sprinkle these little jewel-toned bursts of flavor over the top of the stew as a garnish just before serving.

title: Iranian Stew Fesenjan
text:
Procedure

Grind the Walnuts
Toast the Walnuts
Cook Onions
Cook Chicken Thighs
Add the Ground Walnuts
Add Pomegranate Molasses, Sugar and Saffron
Add the Chicken, Simmer and Season

title: Tiramisù
text: Contains raw eggs

title: Tiramisù
text:
Ingredients

4 fresh eggs
100g sugar
500g mascarpone
Savoiardi (Ladyfingers)
Espresso coffee
Cocoa powder

title: Tiramisù
text:
Procedure

Put 4 egg yolks and 50g of sugar together, mix them well so they become a bit foamy.
Add 500g mascarpone and mix to make it homogeneous.
Mix 4 egg whites so they become like snow, towards the end add the other 50g of sugar.
Mix the two mixtures together.
Put a thin layer of the cream on the bottom of the tray.
Dip the savoiardi in coffee (don’t make them too soaked as they will soften slowly and if you put too much coffee they become too liquid).
As you dip the savoiardi, place them in the tray.
Cover everything with the rest of the cream.
Sprinkle cocoa powder on top before serving.




Yummy

title: Contributing to Our Project
text:
I welcome contributions to this project! Whether you’re fixing bugs, improving documentation, or adding new recipes, your input is greatly appreciated. Please follow the guidelines below to contribute to the project effectively.




To add a new recipe to the repository, please follow these steps:

Navigate to the Recipes Folder: Locate the /recipes subfolder in the project directory.
Create a New Recipe File: Create a new .qmd file within the /recipes subfolder for your recipe. To simplify this process, you can copy an existing recipe file as a template or use the template.qmd file as a starting point.
Add Your Recipe: Populate the new .qmd file with your recipe details. Make sure to follow the formatting and structure of the existing recipes for consistency.
Commit Your Changes: Once you’ve added your recipe, commit your changes with a meaningful commit message. For example:
git commit -m "Add new recipe for [Recipe Name]"





By contributing to this project, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License. Thank you for your contributions! Together, we can make this project even better.

title: Bananabread
text:
125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
125 grams brown sugar
150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
1 good pinch of sea salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini
3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
Juice of 1 lemon

title: Bananabread
text:
125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
125 grams brown sugar
150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
1 good pinch of sea salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini
3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
Juice of 1 lemon

title: Bananabread
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Grease a non-stick loaf pan with butter and dust it with flour (if the loaf pan is not non-stick, you can also line it with parchment paper).
Combine all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl - flours, sugar, seeds, salt, and baking powder - and mix well.
In another bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (leaving them slightly chunky if desired), then add lemon juice and zest, olive oil, yogurt, and beaten eggs, mixing well.
Add the wet ingredients to the bowl of dry ingredients and gently mix - just enough to combine everything.
Transfer the mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Optional: While the cake is baking, prepare the Lemon Drizzle. Stir tahini and powdered sugar in a bowl until smooth, add lemon juice, and mix well.
Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan until it’s cool enough to transfer to a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, place a large plate under the rack, then poke the cake all over with a skewer, pour the drizzle over it, and let it soak in.

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
125 grams ramen noodles
2 garlic cloves
30 grams plant-based butter
1 teaspoon chili flakes
2 teaspoons brown sugar
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 leek
2 eggs (optional)

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
125 grams ramen noodles
2 garlic cloves
30 grams plant-based butter
1 teaspoon chili flakes
2 teaspoons brown sugar
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 leek
2 eggs (optional)

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
Procedure

Cook the ramen in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the garlic cloves.
Heat the plant-based butter in a pan and sauté the garlic. Stir in the chili flakes.
Stir in the brown sugar and dissolve. Add soy sauce and mix in the ramen noodles.
Remove the pan from heat and stir until the noodles are evenly coated.
Slice the leek and set it aside for garnish.
For the non-vegan version, beat two eggs and cook them in a pan until scrambled. Mix the scrambled eggs with the noodles and serve everything together.

Enjoy your meal!

title: Gyoza
text:
100 g pointed cabbage
100 g carrots
100 g minced beef (or tofu)
180 g flour
108 ml boiling water
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 garlic clove
1 tsp stock powder
1 tsp white wine
1 tsp sesame oil
salt
potato starch
cooking oil

title: Gyoza
text:
100 g pointed cabbage
100 g carrots
100 g minced beef (or tofu)
180 g flour
108 ml boiling water
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 garlic clove
1 tsp stock powder
1 tsp white wine
1 tsp sesame oil
salt
potato starch
cooking oil

title: Gyoza
text:
Procedure

Mix flour, 1 tsp of salt and boiling water. When cool enough, start kneading until a smooth dough forms. Leave the dough to rest in cling film for 15 minutes.
Finely chop cabbage, garlic, carrots (and tofu) and mix with soy sauce, stock powder, sesame oil and white wine.
Divide the dough into thirds, roll the thirds into rolls, and cut into 12 pieces. Shape the pieces into “flat cakes” and roll each one in potato starch. Roll out each piece into a thin circle using a rolling pin.
Fill each dough piece with one tbsp of the cabbage mixture. Wet the edge of the circle with some water. Next, fold it into a half circle and pinch the edges together.
Heat cooking oil in a pan. Add Gyoza for about 3 minutes until they brown on the bottom. Add about half a cup of water mixed with a tbsp of flour to the bottom of the pan. Cover the Gyoza for about 8 minutes and let it simmer. Then remove the top and keep the heat on until the water is gone and a crispy bottom has formed.
Enjoy!

Pro Tipp: The recipes works much faster and makes much more fun when you do it with another person, which is why it is the perfect food for a date or an evening with friends :)

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
500g all-purpose flour
7g (1 packet) instant yeast
250ml warm milk
75g granulated sugar
75g unsalted butter, melted
1 teaspoon salt
1 large egg





75g unsalted butter, softened
100g brown sugar
2 tablespoons ground cinnamon





100g powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
500g all-purpose flour
7g (1 packet) instant yeast
250ml warm milk
75g granulated sugar
75g unsalted butter, melted
1 teaspoon salt
1 large egg





75g unsalted butter, softened
100g brown sugar
2 tablespoons ground cinnamon





100g powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
Preparation

Prepare the Dough:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm milk and instant yeast.
Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add the melted butter, sugar, salt, and egg to the yeast mixture.
Stir until well combined.
Gradually add the flour to the mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Prepare the Filling: In a small bowl, mix together the softened butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon until well combined.



Assemble the Rolls:

Once the dough has risen, punch it down and roll it out on a floured surface into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick.
Spread the cinnamon-sugar filling evenly over the dough.
Starting from one long edge, tightly roll up the dough into a log.
Use a sharp knife to cut the log into 12 equal-sized rolls.



Bake the Rolls:

Place the rolls in a greased baking dish, leaving a little space between each roll.
Cover the dish with a clean kitchen towel and let the rolls rise for another 30-45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Once risen, bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.



Make the Glaze:

In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Adjust the consistency by adding more milk if needed.
Serve: Once the rolls are baked, let them cool for a few minutes before drizzling the glaze over the top. Serve warm and enjoy your homemade Zimtschnecken!

title: raspberry sponge cake with meringue
text:
4 egg white
4 egg yolk
270g sugar
1 vanilla sugar
60 g flour
50 g corn starch
1/2 TL baking powder
600 g frozen raspberries
0,5l cream

title: raspberry sponge cake with meringue
text:
4 egg white
4 egg yolk
270g sugar
1 vanilla sugar
60 g flour
50 g corn starch
1/2 TL baking powder
600 g frozen raspberries
0,5l cream

title: raspberry sponge cake with meringue
text:
Procedure

Whisk the egg whites and egg yolks and vanilla sugar stiff for a very long time until foamy (2 egg whites, 4 egg yolks, 1 vanilla sugar)
Sift in the flour, cornstarch and baking powder and pour everything into a greased springform pan (60 g of flour, 50 g of cornstarch, 1 teaspoon of baking powder)
Whisk the egg whites and sugar stiff until foamy and spoon onto the batter (2 egg whites, 230 g of sugar)
Bake at 175 degrees for about half an hour on the middle to lower rack.
Then let the cake cool and cut it in the middle.
Place the frozen raspberries on the bottom half, sprinkle with sugar, and then spread the whipped cream (600 g of frozen raspberries, 40 g of sugar, 0.5 liters of whipped cream)
Place the top half of the cake on the filling and let it stand for a few hours (not in the refrigerator). Alternatively, you can thaw the raspberries beforehand if there is not enough time.

title: Cup of Sugar
text:
roll the dice on how much sugar you want.

dice <- c(1,2,3,4,5,6)
amount_of_sugar <- sample(dice, 1)

title: Cup of Sugar
text:
roll the dice on how much sugar you want.

dice <- c(1,2,3,4,5,6)
amount_of_sugar <- sample(dice, 1)

title: Cup of Sugar
